image.altText: Fatty globules washed up on a sandy beach

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority has found low levels of antibiotic present in fatty salmon globules that have been washing up on south-east Tasmanian beaches following a mass salmon die-off. The Public Health Director says the antibiotic does not pose a risk to animal or human health.

title.children: Low levels of antibiotic detected in salmon material found on Tasmanian beaches

image.altText: Scenic coastal picture taken by drone, shows calm ocean, sand and coastal scrub on a clear day.
